summary: The Servicemember Healthcare Freedom Act of 2025 aims to allow members of the Selected Reserve and National Guard who are also federal employees to choose between their military healthcare plan (TRICARE Reserve Select) and the Federal Employee Health Benefits (FEHB) program. The bill's key provision modifies the eligibility rules to enable enrollment in TRS plans starting January 1, 2026, aiming to provide continuity of care, improve readiness, and increase healthcare access for these service members.
